articles.title: Giant Jets Bigger Than The Milky Way Seen Shooting From Black Hole
articles.description: A supermassive black hole in the early Universe has been spotted blasting out powerful jets of plasma that are at least twice as long as the Milky Way is wide.
articles.content:
A supermassive black hole in the early Universe has been spotted blasting out powerful jets of plasma that are at least twice as long as the Milky Way is wide.
Its host galaxy is a quasar called J1601+3102, and we're seeing it as it was less than 1.2... [2791 chars]

articles.title: Why are sunsets so pretty in winter? There’s a simple explanation
articles.description: At certain times of year, sunsets seem to hit differently. It’s not just your imagination – it’s science.
articles.content:
If you live in the southern hemisphere and have been stopped in your tracks by a recent sunset, you may have noticed they seem more vibrant lately. The colours are brighter and bolder, and they linger longer in the sky.
Why are sunsets “better” at so... [3754 chars]

articles.title: Monash IVF CEO Michael Knaap resigns after second embryo bungle
articles.description: The move was announced on the ASX this morning.
articles.content:
Monash IVF chief executive officer Michael Knaap has resigned following the reveal of a second embryo bungle.
In a statement to the ASX, Monash IVF said its board had accepted Mr Knaap's resignation and "respects his decision".

articles.title: F1 Academy driver Joanne Ciconte blazing a trail for Australian girls in motor racing
articles.description: Joanne Ciconte is the first Australian to score championship points in F1's all-female category, the first of potentially many accolades for the teenager.
articles.content:
At just 16 years of age, Joanne Ciconte is living life in the fast lane.
The Melbourne-born teenager spends a significant portion of her life on planes, travelling around the world in pursuit of speed.
Ciconte is the youngest driver in this year's F1... [3224 chars]

articles.title: Richard Marles downplays Trump administration's review of AUKUS
articles.description: Australia's defence minister insists he is not concerned about the country's prospects of acquiring nuclear-powered submarines, despite the US government announcing a review of the security pact.
articles.content:
Defence Minister Richard Marles has downplayed concerns the United States will review the AUKUS agreement, insisting it is a "natural" step and will not threaten the acquisition of nuclear-powered submarines.

articles.description: Kysaiah Pickett has turned his back on strong interest from WA to remain with Melbourne, signing with the club until the end of 2034.
